page.title: 17A MEMBER OF PARLIAMENT
page.content: Sir Patrick Mayhew lives at Twysden House. He is the Member of Parliament for the Tunbridge Wells Constituency. He is also the Solicitor General. Twysden House was built in 1485, the same year that Parliament was formed. A General Election is held every five years unless the government lose support, when it will be sooner. People over 18 vote for new Members of Parliament. The main party in Parliament govern the Country. There are two houses of parliament, the House of Commons and the House of Lords. The House of Commons is where the M.P.s meet. The House of Lords is where the Lords go. Sir Patrick Mayhew's job is to tell the Government what the law is, so that they do not break the law. As Member of Parliament he helps people from the Constituency.
